reason: The '_journalDiskSync' configuration in the Prevayler software project directly influences how frequently the system writes journal entries to disk. If set to a more frequent sync, it can lead to increased disk I/O operations, which may significantly affect execution time and overall system throughput. Conversely, less frequent syncing can improve performance but risks data loss in case of a crash. Therefore, changes to this configuration can lead to notable variations in execution time and resource consumption, classifying it as performance-sensitive.
